item.title: 米国立気象局唯一の気象番組「アラスカ・ウェザー」が7月1日からYouTubeに移行し、インターネットが不安定な人はアクセスしづらくなる（Mark Thiessen/Associated Press）
item.description:
Mark Thiessen / Associated Press:
The US National Weather Service's only weather show, Alaska Weather, is moving to YouTube on July 1, making access difficult for those with unreliable internet  —  Before Morris Nashoanak heads out for days in search of bearded seals, beluga whales or salmon, he catches the weather on TV.

IPSO says Jeremy Clarkson made a “pejorative and prejudicial” reference to Meghan Markle's sex in a column in The Sun, which must publish a front-page statement  —  The U.K.'s media watchdog, the Independent Press Standards Organisation (IPSO), has upheld two complaints lodged …

item.description:
Andrew Dalton / Associated Press:
Actors could join writers on strike as soon as June 30 at midnight PDT, but both sides are open to talking past the deadline for SAG-AFTRA's studio negotiations  —  Hollywood actors may be on the verge of joining screenwriters in what would be the first two-union strike in the industry …

item.title: 報道エフゲニー・プリゴージンがパトリオット・メディア・グループを閉鎖し、ロスコムナゾールがいくつかのニュース配信をブロック。
item.description:
The Moscow Times:
Reports: Yevgeny Prigozhin shuts down Patriot Media Group, and Roskomnadzor blocks several of its news outlets; Prigozhin has not confirmed or denied the claims  —  Wagner mercenary group leader Yevgeny Prigozhin has closed down his St. Petersburg-based media holding, according to multiple media reports published Friday.

item.title: 情報筋Spotifyは、ビデオをサービスの中核として確立するための拡大努力の一環として、長編ミュージックビデオの追加についてパートナーと話し合っている（Ashley Carman/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
Sources: Spotify is talking to its partners about adding full-length music videos, as part of growing efforts to establish video as a core part of its service  —  Spotify Technology SA is considering adding full-length music videos to its app, which could help the streaming service better compete …

item.title: 解雇されたフォックス・ニュースのプロデューサー、アビー・グロスバーグがフォックス、タッカー・カールソン、複数の幹部に対する訴訟を1200万ドルで和解。
item.description:
Jane C. Timm / NBC News:
Fired Fox News producer Abby Grossberg settles her lawsuits against Fox, Tucker Carlson, and several executives for $12M; she had called Fox a toxic workplace  —  Abby Grossberg, who worked on Tucker Carlson's and Maria Bartiromo's shows, said she was harassed and set up to be a scapegoat in the Dominion defamation suit.

item.title: Twitterは、ログインせずにウェブ上のツイート、ユーザープロフィール、コメントスレッドを閲覧できなくなり、すべてのTwitter URLがサインインページにリダイレクトされる（Jess Weatherbed/The Verge）。
item.description:
Jess Weatherbed / The Verge:
Twitter no longer lets users browse tweets, user profiles, and comment threads on the web without logging in, redirecting all Twitter URLs to the sign in page  —  If you currently try to access Twitter without logging in to your user account, you may find you're unable to see any of the content …

item.title: ESPNが放送コメンテーターをレイオフ、情報筋によると、NBAのトップアナリスト、ジェフ・ヴァン・ガンディ、マックス・ケラーマン、キーショーン・ジョンソンら20人に影響（Andrew Marchand/New York Post）
item.description:
Andrew Marchand / New York Post:
ESPN lays off on-air commentators, sources say affecting ~20 personalities, including top NBA game analyst Jeff Van Gundy, Max Kellerman, and Keyshawn Johnson  —  ESPN is laying off some of its biggest stars in a purge that is expected to result in around 20 on-air personalities being let go Friday …

item.title: ブルキナファソ、LCIを停職処分、仏TV報道局の2023年4月反乱報道は客観性を欠く、外国メディア取り締まりの最新版（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
Burkina Faso suspends LCI, saying the French TV news channel's April 2023 report on an insurgency lacked objectivity, the latest in its foreign media crackdown  —  Burkina Faso's military government has suspended a French television news channel for a report on a jihadist insurgency …

item.title: インドの裁判所、政府のコンテンツ規制に対するツイッターの訴えを棄却、遵守の遅れを説明しなかったとして同社に〜6万1000ドルの罰金（Manish Singh/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Manish Singh / TechCrunch:
An Indian court dismisses Twitter's lawsuit against the government's content rules and fines the company ~$61K for failing to explain its delayed compliance  —  An Indian court has dismissed Twitter's lawsuit against the federal government that sought to challenge New Delhi's block orders on tweets and accounts.

item.description:
Casey Hall / Reuters:
Chinese livestream shopping shifts from big discounts, as Apple and other brands seek control over a process made costly by a fragmenting market and superhosts  —  When tech giant Apple (AAPL.O) joined China's livestreaming frenzy, a major driving force of the e-commerce boom …

Nitish Pahwa / Slate:
Canada may think Bill C-18 still has more room for negotiation, based on Meta's 2021 deal with Australia, but tech platforms no longer view news as valuable  —  On June 22, the Canadian Parliament passed Bill C-18, also known as the Online News Act.  The new law, according to a government news release …

item.description:
Sharon Knolle / The Wrap:
Unionized G/O media employees blast the company, which owns The Onion, Quartz, The Root, Deadspin, and more, over its plans to test AI-created content next week  —  “Cease [your] plans to litter our websites with AI-generated content,” unionized editorial employees at The Onion, Deadspin and The Root say

item.title: 情報筋ネクスターのWOOD-TV、プライド月間の "両側 "報道を促したメモで報道部長2人を解雇、他2人はメモのリークで解雇（Matthew Keys/The Desk）
item.description:
Matthew Keys / The Desk:
Sources: Nexstar's WOOD-TV fires two news managers over a memo that urged covering “both sides” of Pride Month; two others were fired for leaks about the memo  —  Nexstar also dismisses Amy Fox, the writer of the memo, and two producers suspected of leaking information to the press.
